DataElement.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Prior Thaw At Facility Storage Method Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the storage method used for the cord blood unit.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Prior Thaw At Facility Storage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Blood from the placenta (afterbirth) that contains high concentrations of stem cells needed to produce new blood cells._Earlier in time or order._The process whereby heat changes something from a solid to a liquid._Used to indicate position, location, or state._Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry._The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The process whereby heat changes something from a solid to a liquid.:Used to indicate position, location, or state (American Heritage Dictionary):Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

Concepts.definition: The process whereby heat changes something from a solid to a liquid.
Used to indicate position, location, or state.
Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Storage Method Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Blood from the umbilical cord of a newborn baby. This blood contains high concentrations of stem cells (cells from which all blood cells develop)._The act of safekeeping goods in a depository._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A physical phenomenon associated with stationary or moving electrons and protons; energy made available by the flow of electric charge through a conductor.: The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase.

Concepts.definition: A physical phenomenon associated with stationary or moving electrons and protons; energy made available by the flow of electric charge through a conductor.
The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase when the temperature is lowered.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cryogenic process for the storage and/or shipping of  biospecimens. The item to be frozen is placed above a shallow reservoir of cooling liquid in a storage vessel. A vertical temperature gradient is maintained throughout the vapor layer to ensure temperatures sufficiently low to maintain the integrity of the stored material.

Concepts.definition: A cryogenic process for the storage and/or shipping of biospecimens. The item to be frozen is placed above a shallow reservoir of cooling liquid in a storage vessel. A vertical temperature gradient is maintained throughout the vapor layer to ensure temperatures sufficiently low to maintain the integrity of the stored material.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A substance in the fluid state of matter having no fixed shape but a fixed volume.: Nitrogen

Concepts.definition: A substance in the fluid state of matter having no fixed shape but a fixed volume.
An element with atomic symbol N, atomic number 7, and atomic weight 14.01.
